title: Nikola Radmanovac
text:
Nikola Radmanovac (; born 30 January 1997) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for <a href="FK%20Radnik%20Surdulica">Radnik Surdulac</a>.
Club career.
Napredak Kruševac.
Born in Kruševac, Radmanovac passed the <a href="FK%20Napredak%20Kru%C5%A1evac">Napredak Kruševac</a> youth school. He has joined the first team for the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Serbian%20SuperLiga">2014–15</a> season, but he stayed with U19 selection until 2016. Previously, he signed a two-year scholarship contract with club in summer 2015. He made his senior debut in 25 fixture match of <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Serbian%20First%20League">2015–16 Serbian First League</a> season, against <a href="FK%20Kolubara">Kolubara</a>, replacing <a href="Bohdan%20Sichkaruk">Bohdan Sichkaruk</a> in 71 minute of the match. After <a href="Milo%C5%A1%20Vuli%C4%87">Miloš Vulić</a> was substituted out in the second half the last match of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Serbian%20First%20League">2015–16 Serbian First League</a> season, Radmanovac spent the rest of match as a team captain. In summer 2016, Radmanovac was loaned to <a href="Serbian%20League%20East">Serbian League East</a> side <a href="FK%20Trstenik%20PPT">Prva Petoletka</a> for a one-year dual registration, which was terminated after 6 months. He also spent the spring half-season as a loaned player with <a href="FK%20Brodarac%201947">Brodarac 1947</a>. In summer 2017, Radmanovac signed a two-year professional contract with Napredak, after which he moved on loan deal to <a href="FK%20Be%C5%BEanija">Bežanija</a>. At the beginning 2018, Radmanovac returned to Napredak. In mid season of the 2017–18 campaign, Radmanovac moved on loan to the local club <a href="FK%20Trayal%20Kru%C5%A1evac">Trayal</a> until the end of the 2017–18 campaign in the <a href="Serbian%20League%20East">Serbian League East</a>.
